a.g: The Inevitable Reality -
What is the Inevitable Reality?
And what can make you know what is the Inevitable Reality?
Thamud and 'Aad denied the Striking Calamity.
So as for Thamud, they were destroyed by the overpowering [blast].
And as for 'Aad, they were destroyed by a screaming, violent wind
Which Allah imposed upon them for seven nights and eight days in succession, so you would see the people therein fallen as if they were hollow trunks of palm trees.
Then do you see of them any remains?
And there came Pharaoh and those before him and the overturned cities with sin.
And they disobeyed the messenger of their Lord, so He seized them with a seizure exceeding [in severity].
Indeed, when the water overflowed, We carried your ancestors in the sailing ship
That We might make it for you a reminder and [that] a conscious ear would be conscious of it.
Then when the Horn is blown with one blast
And the earth and the mountains are lifted and leveled with one blow -

ğŸ“– Vol 4: Remembrance of Death and the Afterlife
On that day you will see the earth shaken with its shaking, and the earth will cast out its burdens, then the people will emerge in groups to see their deeds. On the day the earth and the mountains are carried and crushed with a single crushing, then the Event (al-Waqi'ah) will occur and the sky will split, so it will be frail on that day, and the angels will be on its edges, and the Throne (Arsh) of your Lord will be carried above them on that day by eight. On that day you will be presented, nothing hidden from you will be concealed. On the day the mountains will move and you will see the earth bare, on the day the earth will be shaken with a shaking and the mountains will be pulverized with a pulverization so they become scattered dust, on the day the people will be like scattered moths and the mountains will be like carded wool, on the day every nursing mother will be distracted from what she nursed and every pregnant one will deliver her burden and you will see the people intoxicated while they are not intoxicated but the punishment of Allah is severe, on the day the earth will be changed to another earth and the heavens and they will appear before Allah the One, the Subduer (al-Qahhar), on the day the mountains will be blown away with a blowing so they leave a level plain where you see no crookedness nor unevenness, on the day you will see the mountains, you think them fixed while they pass like the passing of clouds, on the day the sky will split so it becomes like red leather, then on that day no human nor jinn will be asked about his sin, on the day the disobedient will be prevented from speech and no inquiry will be made about crimes but they will be seized by the forelocks and the feet, on the day every soul (Nafs) will find what it did of good present and what it did of evil it wishes there were a great distance between it and that, on the day every soul (Nafs) will know what it has brought and will testify to what it sent ahead and left behind, on the day the tongues will be silenced and the limbs will speak.

a.g: Then on that Day, the Resurrection will occur,
And the heaven will split [open], for that Day it is infirm.
And the angels are at its edges. And there will bear the Throne of your Lord above them, that Day, eight [of them].
That Day, you will be exhibited [for judgement]; not hidden among you is anything concealed.
So as for he who is given his record in his right hand, he will say, "Here, read my record!
Indeed, I was certain that I would be meeting my account."
So he will be in a pleasant life -
In an elevated garden,
Its [fruit] to be picked hanging near.
[They will be told], "Eat and drink in satisfaction for what you put forth in the days past."

ğŸ“– Vol 3: Breaking the Two Desires
In summary, there is no way to neglect the Soul (Nafs) in permissible desires and follow it in every circumstance. To the extent that the servant fulfills his desire, he fears that it will be said to him on the Day of Resurrection: 'You exhausted your good things in your worldly life and enjoyed them.' And to the extent that he struggles against his Soul (Nafs) and abandons his desire, he will enjoy in the Abode of the Hereafter with his desires. Some people of Basra said: My Soul (Nafs) contended with me for rice bread and fish, so I prevented it. Its demand strengthened and my struggle against it intensified for twenty years. When he died, some of them said: I saw him in a dream and said: What did Allah do with you? He said: I cannot describe what my Lord met me with of blessings and honors, and the first thing that welcomed me was rice bread and fish. And He said: Eat today your desire pleasantly without account. And Allah the Exalted said: 'Eat and drink pleasantly for what you sent ahead in the past days.' And they had sent ahead the abandonment of desires. And for that reason, Abu Sulayman said: Abandoning one desire from the desires is more beneficial for the Heart (Qalb) than fasting a year and standing in prayer during it. May Allah grant us success in what pleases Him.

ğŸ“– Vol 1: Secrets of Fasting
And Waki' said regarding His statement, the Exalted: 'Eat and drink pleasantly for what you sent ahead in the days that have passed' (Quran 69:24) - they are the days of fasting since they abandoned in them eating and drinking. And the Messenger of God (peace be upon him) gathered in the rank of boasting between asceticism (Zuhd) in the worldly life and fasting, saying: 'Indeed God, the Exalted, boasts to His angels about the worshipping youth, saying: O youth who abandoned his desire for My sake, who expended his youth for Me, you are with Me like some of My angels.' And he (peace be upon him) said regarding the fasting person: 'God, the Mighty and Majestic, says: Look, O My angels, at My servant who abandoned his desire, his pleasure, his food, and his drink for My sake.'

And had not known what is my account.
I wish my death had been the decisive one.
My wealth has not availed me.

ğŸ“– Vol 4: Remembrance of Death and the Afterlife
And it was narrated about Harun al-Rashid that he selected his burial shrouds with his own hand at the time of death, and he was looking at them and saying: 'My wealth (Mali) has not availed me (Ma Aghna 'Anni Maliyah) - my authority has perished from me.' And al-Ma'mun spread ashes and lay upon them, and he was saying: 'O You whose dominion does not vanish, have mercy upon one whose dominion has vanished.'

a.g: Gone from me is my authority."
[Allah will say], "Seize him and shackle him.
Then into Hellfire drive him.
Then into a chain whose length is seventy cubits insert him."
Indeed, he did not used to believe in Allah, the Most Great,
Nor did he encourage the feeding of the poor.
So there is not for him here this Day any devoted friend
Nor any food except from the discharge of wounds;
None will eat it except the sinners.
So I swear by what you see
And what you do not see
[That] indeed, the Qur'an is the word of a noble Messenger.
And it is not the word of a poet; little do you believe.
Nor the word of a soothsayer; little do you remember.
[It is] a revelation from the Lord of the worlds.
And if Muhammad had made up about Us some [false] sayings,
We would have seized him by the right hand;
Then We would have cut from him the aorta.
And there is no one of you who could prevent [Us] from him.
And indeed, the Qur'an is a reminder for the righteous.
And indeed, We know that among you are deniers.
And indeed, it will be [a cause of] regret upon the disbelievers.
And indeed, it is the truth of certainty.
So exalt the name of your Lord, the Most Great.
